content:
IDbDataParameter Interface

Definition

Used by the Visual Basic .NET Data Designers to represent a parameter to a Command object, and optionally, its mapping to DataSet columns.

In this Article

public interface IDbDataParameter : System.Data.IDataParameter

Properties

Precision

Indicates the precision of numeric parameters.

public byte Precision { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The maximum number of digits used to represent the Value property of a data provider Parameter object. The default value is 0, which indicates that a data provider sets the precision for Value.

Scale

Indicates the scale of numeric parameters.

public byte Scale { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The number of decimal places to which Value is resolved. The default is 0.

Size

The size of the parameter.

public int Size { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The maximum size, in bytes, of the data within the column. The default value is inferred from the the parameter value.
